reviews.review_msg: Has morally corrupt policies such as refusing to round 84.9999 grades to an 85. Requires that assignments are handed in at 11:59 AM. Yes, you read that right, AM. Grades papers quite harshly for a 100 level course definitely not a GPA booster by any means. I would avoid this class you would get a better boost elsewhere try ARCH226

Accused most of the class of AI without ANY PROOF and in a very condescending way. She also expects us to hand in assignments at NOON. Course content was good. Prof and assignments were not. Word count too short for assignments, yet they asked for more details.
Just don't take it with her she sets you up for failure not success in the class. Accuses the whole class for using AI and plagiarism, but in a very threatening way.

I've noticed the prof has reported and removed some negative feedback on RMP. This prof is horrendous to achieve clear, efficient communication, especially through email. Sends so many follow up emails “clarifying” but nothing makes sense and tends to backtrack on previous points. Seems all over the place. lazy with their care and effort of class

prof accused all of the class of using AI by sending a threatening email to everyone that we MUST come forward or things will be brought to further meetings with SFU abt academic dishonesty. Has zero (0, none, nothing) proof of academic violations, telling us our work looks like AI because it's not specific enough. Off of a 150 word annotated bib.

Prof writes her own positive reviews here. Protected by a union so unfortunately cannot take her false accusations of plagiarism and academic dishonesty to the dean because nothing will be done. Gross and disgusting that profs like this have so much power and are using it negatively. DO NOT RECOMMEND this prof as she is accusatory without proof

She is not the greatest professor I have had at SFU, she accuses the entire class of cheating. She expects graduate level work for an intro class. Has a very confusing grading criteria making it very difficult to do well in this class. Avoid this professor for any class if you can.
What a terrible experience. Such a lazy professor and an unpleasant course. A waste of my tuition!!! Never take a class with this professor
Really inconsiderate and has an attitude. Avoid her please.

Such a lazy and unhelpful prof, lectures are not even her own and she makes up citation requirements that are extremely confusing for her assignments. Sends out 10 announcements for one reason and each one more confusing than the last.
Awesome professor! Although Michelle has high expectations, they also provide clear instructions and follow ups to make things easier.

Please avoid this professor at all costs. The TAs are unnecessarily strict. The professor has done a very good job of making the experience the worst possible. She sends out emails complaining about the mistakes students made in the exams and how half the class got zero without releasing the marks beforehand,increasing our anxiety to the next level

Hard to reach, and one of the most unorganized and all over the place professors I've ever had. Lectures are pre-recorded, and assignments are always the same regardless of professor for this course. TAs are hard markers, have higher expectations than necessary for a 1st year class and often don't even follow their own rubric. Not a GPA booster.

The professor just assigns online readings and video lectures from other professors putting zero effort in the course themselves. Grading and expectations for assignments and general writing assignments are way more than a first year online course should be, especially since they didn't put any actual effort on their end to actually  teach.
awesome class and didn't require more than a few weekly hours and interest in the topic
She is really nice instructor and we can get easily good grades in her class. She is not strict means she has friendly behaviour with all the students .
Useless lectures more like a gossip session, do not need to attend class, projects are unclear and marks come out of no where
